ref: 9668 bhrāˊtr̥vya m. ʻ brother's son (?), rival ʼ AV. [Orig. ʻ brother's son ʼ (EWA ii 531 with lit.: corresponding Ir. forms in EVP 89 s.v. wrārə): then transferred to ʻ father's brother's son ʼ, i.e. the children of the house use their father's term for his brother's son, viz. their cousin. -- bhrāˊtr̥ -- ]
Ash. boā́tr̥ ʻ cousin, male relation ʼ (ac. to NTS vii 86 contains -- putra -- ),
Dm. brādī (also used as pl. of brâ ʻ brother ʼ NTS xii 160: < *brādrī NTS xii 130),
Sh. (Lor.) ẓauwo, J̣au˚ ʻ wife's sister's son, husband's sister's son, woman's brother's son ʼ, ẓauwi ʻ wife's sister's daughter, husband's sister's daughter, woman's brother's daughter ʼ.
